title: On Tuza's conjecture for triangulations and graphs with small treewidth

lemmas.name: tuza_treewidth_6
lemmas.statement: theorem tuza_treewidth_6 (G : SimpleGraph V) (h : treewidth G ≤ 6) : triangleCoveringNumber G ≤ 2 * trianglePackingNumber G
lemmas.english: Graphs with treewidth at most 6 satisfy Tuza
lemmas.needs_validation: Need to define treewidth in Lean (complex)

lemmas.name: tuza_triangulation
lemmas.statement: theorem tuza_triangulation (G : SimpleGraph V) (h : isTriangulation G) (hne : G ≠ K4) : 2 * triangleCoveringNumber G ≤ 3 * trianglePackingNumber G
implications: Better than Tuza for special class

key_insight: Bounded treewidth implies Tuza. Any nu=4 counterexample must have treewidth >= 7.
blocker: Treewidth definition in Lean is complex, not in Mathlib
notes: Could potentially use as constraint on counterexample search
